availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew Quillen (Letcher County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier (CSA and USA) ("Drewry"))

body.p: Letcher County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Henry Quillen and Elizabeth Quillen. Resident of Letcher County in 1850. Farm laborer in Letcher County in 1860. Mustered into service in the 13th Kentucky Cavalry (C.S.A.) as a private on October 4, 1862. Served in the Sandy Valley Battalion of the 1st Regiment Kentucky Guards (U.S.A.) as a private from May 10, 1864 to September 12, 1864. Reported as deserted on May 12, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky: Confederate Kentucky Volunteers War 1861-65, vol. 1 (Frankfort: Legislature of Kentucky, 1915), 154.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Letcher, District 2, p. 134B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Letcher, p. 694.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 774.
